item.title: The big picture
item.description:
The big picture

Having introduced the new libary in a previous post, I thought it might be helpful to describe the overall architecture of the library. The top-most package contains the main algorithm and interface definitions. Actual implementations are create in sub-packages.

item.title: Starting with the end game
item.description:
Starting with the end game

A couple of years back, I decided to learn Go by implementing a new NEAT distribution from scratch. My plan was to use just Stanley and Miikkulainen's paper as a guide and deliver a flexible Go package. Well, the journey took a lot longer than expected and what I ended up creating was only just mildly flexible and not very good Go code either. So let's consider this a NEAT for Go reboot and, this, time giving it a fancy new name: redq.NEAT.Â
